file_content.text: Fantastic, apprentice. You're just in time for my surprise. Since you left for the Dark Temple, I've been reading and reading and reading.
Skotia's chambers are a treasure trove of research. Who would've thought a man like that had such a curious intellect?
It almost makes me regret that we had to kill him. But let me see this wonderful artifact you found!
If you knew what I had to go through to get this....
It was a lot of trouble.
It was a challenge, and you overcame it utterly.
It almost makes me regret that we had to kill him. But I digress--I trust you were successful in the Dark Temple?
You mentioned you had something for me?
About this surprise....
Indeed. I did. And I'll get to it in a moment.
Take it.
Excellent. Magnificent. It all begins here, apprentice.
Did you expect otherwise?
Are you really surprised?
Of course not.
But tell me, how did you manage to pacify the apparition?
Apparently, he was my ancestor.
We were related.
Remarkable. A slave's lost ancestor turns up in the Dark Temple, and I sense your incredible destiny doesn't stop there.
The apparition seemed to think you'd betray me.
Not sure, but he hates you.
Then that ghost is an idiot. I am not so stupid, you are my most valued apprentice. Now--
First I took a magnet, and then a chance cube....
I had to do a zany puzzle.
Fair enough. Your secrets are your own. I, however, will not be so guarded.
I have been studying Tulak Hord's artifacts closely for some time, and one glance at this one you've brought back confirms everything I've suspected.
These artifacts will change everything, apprentice--you, especially. They will make you more powerful than you could imagine. I have foreseen it.
What do the artifacts do exactly?
What do they do?
I don't know. I can imagine quite a bit of power.
Try me.
Never such as this.
Let me guess, you've been dreaming again.
More dreams?
Always and ever.
This artifact is one of five that together describe a peculiar ritual used by the great Tulak Hord when he conquered the Dromund system.
Until I have all the artifacts, I cannot understand the full nature of the ritual, but I have foreseen that you alone will wield the ritual's power.
I don't understand. Why me?
Why me?
Why not you? You're a powerful, promising young Sith.
A natural choice, if I do say so myself.
Of course.
You may, deservedly.
So where are these other artifacts?
Where are they?
The artifacts are scattered across the galaxy; some hidden by Tulak Hord himself, and some wrenched from his hands by betrayers.
Documents in Skotia's effects point to Balmorra and Nar Shaddaa, but I will need to do more research to locate the other two.
I'll get started right away.
I'm on it.
It's not much to go on, but I will continue my work behind the scenes to get you more information.
Um, what do I do to get there?
Is there a shuttle?
Ah, yes, that brings me to my surprise.
It seems I'm always stuck serving others.
I feel like your slave.
Nonsense! You are doing this for yourself, apprentice. I have foreseen the power you will gain.
But first--I believe I mentioned a surprise earlier.
If you're going to find these artifacts, you'll need a ship and so I have ordered you one. All you need to do is pick it up.
For me? You're too kind.
A ship!
About time I got something for all my hardwork.
You owed me that much.
Yes, you've earned it.
So where do I go?
You'll find your ship at the spaceport. Then, the galaxy is yours to explore.
Don't forget to contact me when you reach each planet for more information on the artifacts' locations. Good luck, and good hunting.
She will never command the power of Tulak Hord. Remember, little Sith, I am always hungry.
If you're going to find these artifacts, you'll need a ship. Luckily, I recovered one that belonged to a relative of yours.
Apprentice! Do you have the artifact yet?
I have the artifact in hand.
It's yours.
What do you think?
Guess.
Of course. Brilliant. Magnificent!
Hurry back to Skotia's--I mean, my--chambers. I cannot wait to see this artifact, and I have a surprise for you.
You wouldn't want to spoil the surprise now, would you?
That would be telling.
Oh. Oh. You're teasing me, apprentice.
Hurry back to Skotia's--I mean, my--chambers. I have a surprise for you.
I'll see you in Skotia's chambers shortly.
Understood.
Good, good. Oh, I can't wait!
What kind of surprise?
Surprise?
Now that's my little secret.
I love surprises!
Oh boy!
Trust me--you'll love it.
Now, hurry back with the artifact! I can't wait!
The artifact is in the Dark Temple. Be careful.
Remember the map you found on Korriban that pointed us to the power of Tulak Hord? The first piece of that artifact, that power, is here on Dromund Kaas.
This piece is in the deepest chamber of the Dark Temple. Skotia always hoarded the key to the chamber like a Hutt hoards his credits.
Why didn't he want anyone to enter the chamber?
I don't understand.
He was jealous of my power, for one. He also had this foolish idea some powers are best left undisturbed--hardly the Sith way.
If he weren't already dead, I'd crush him.
That fool.
Save your vitriol for the living.
So that's why we had to kill him.
That explains a lot.
Precisely.
Now I have Skotia's title, his chambers, his research and his key. He always said I would enter the Dark Temple over his rusting corpse.
However, I won't be the one to go into the Dark Temple--you will.
It will be my pleasure.
As you say.
Why me?
Why not you?
I always have to do your dirty work.
Me again.
Her breath stinks of Sith lies.
Listen to me: There's a reason I picked my apprentice from the lower classes--a reason you, and not that blue-blood Ffon, had to come here.
Before I went to Korriban to choose an apprentice, a furious apparition awakened in the Dark Temple, implacable in its anger, murdering all who trespassed on the innermost chamber.
But I had a dream. An apprentice of low origin humbled himself--or herself, as it happened--before the apparition, pacifying it. That's why you and your peers were chosen.
But I had a dream. An apprentice of low origin humbled himself before the apparition, pacifying it. That's why you and your peers were singled out.
I wouldn't put so much faith in dreams.
Maybe it was just a dream.
Dreams are when the Force speaks to us most loudly--I believe what I have foreseen.
I always knew I was special.
I am great.
You've been a far more capable apprentice than I even hoped--but for this task, you must put aside your pride.
Wait--you want me to bow to this apparition?
Humble myself?
You must go into the temple and face the apparition, and when you do, I believe that your humility will be the key.
Still, I want you to know--I'm not certain you're the one from my dream. I fear I may be sending you to your death.
You're a Sith, start acting like one.
Toughen up, woman.
Don't worry about me, master.
Hardly.
You're right. You retrieved the holocron on Korriban when no one else could--if that's not proof of your destiny, I don't know what is.
I eat apparitions for dinner!
I like killing ghosts.
You have a wonderfully deranged mind. And you're right.
Tulak Hord's power awaits us both. We must not lose sight of this goal.
Use this glyph to enter the innermost chamber of the Dark Temple. Humble yourself before the apparition, and bring back the piece of the artifact.
Even the great Tulak Hord did not tangle with spirits. Tread lightly, little Sith.
Perfect timing, apprentice. I just met with that insufferable Thanaton, and I have good news.
How did your meeting go?
How was it?
Everyone's talking about how you killed Skotia.
You've caused quite a stir.
Good. Let them talk. They can't prove anything--and it'll drive them mad.
And my meeting went exactly as I planned.
Who is this "Darth Thanaton"?
Thanaton?
Darth Thanaton sits just below the Dark Council in authority. He commands me, he commands you.
Skotia was his little pet, but the other council members were more impressed with our little sleight of hand.
You would've been proud of me. I went in to a reprimand--but I emerged a Darth.
You've certainly earned it.
Congratulations.
Do I get a promotion, too?
And what about me?
For now you remain my capable apprentice. However, a Darth can raise an apprentice to a lord--so your prospects just improved.
All you did was go to a party.
I'm not impressed.
I did more than you realize; nevertheless, what's important is that we are finally free to act.
Well, when I heard she'd taken up with a Mandalorian, I was scandalized, just scandalized!
A Mandalorian! Does nobody value Sith blood these days?
I know, I know. Don't you think so, Zash?
These prattling creatures call themselves Sith? The legacy of Tulak Hord is lost.
I'm sorry, will you excuse me? I need to have a quick chat with my apprentice.
If you must. Now, as I was saying....
Thank the Emperor you've arrived. It doesn't matter how much one drinks--these parties are just dull dull dull dull dull.
I hope you've come to cheer me up.
I have done as you wished, and killed the Darth.
Skotia's dead.
Brilliant. Simply brilliant.
Your plan worked perfectly.
I think you'll be pleased.
I have dismantled the machine.
Call me "Darth-killer."
He's dead, then. Excellent.
You have performed magnificently, apprentice. None of this would've been possible without you.
Lord Zash.
Darth Thanaton! I'm honored.
Don't let me interrupt you.
Should I be going?
You going to introduce me?
Who's the Darth?
Sorry, I'll just be a minute. Don't go anywhere, I have some further instructions for you.
Uh, yes--I'll just let you two chat.
Whoa, important guy.
Don't go anywhere just yet, apprentice. This call won't take long, and I have some further instructions for you.
As I said, my lord, I'm honored, but why call me?
You have nerve, Zash--nerve. But I thought you were smarter.
With all respect, Darth Thanaton, I don't know what you're talking about.
Don't play ignorant with me, Zash. Skotia's dead, and you killed him.
Skotia? Dead? That's the first I've heard of it. When did this happen?
Just now, Zash--and you know it. What did you expect to gain? His position? His title? You know it doesn't work that way. Where's your discretion!
Discretion! I've been at this party for ages. I may have had a little much to drink, but I'm fairly certain I haven't murdered anyone.
Though I have always fancied Skotia's chambers--so much more shelf space.
Zash! I don't want to have this conversation by holo. Report to my chambers immediately.
Yes, Darth Thanaton. It will be my pleasure.
What was that all about?
Care to explain that?
Looks like you have a meeting to get to.
Sounds like you have to go.
Are we in trouble?
Uh-oh.
Give me time to talk to Thanaton and then meet me in Darth Skotia's chambers.
And don't worry--you've played your part, now it's time for me to play mine. We did it, apprentice.
Skotia must die. We cannot delay.
Skotia is in his chambers as we speak. Be ready--even with the power you have over him, he will be a frightful sight.
The little Sith and I will feast.
Set your nerves of cortosis; turn your fear into hatred. Remember--Skotia stands between us and glory.
Let's get to the killing.
I can't wait.
I feel as though I've lived my whole life for this moment.
Of course.
Good. Now, listen closely--this is how you will kill Skotia.
I don't see how you plan to make this work.
I'm still skeptical.
The relic you found under the colossus is the key to Skotia's power over his Trandoshan bodyguards. Go to Skotia's chambers and show them the relic.
The Trandoshans should stand down, or attack him, or something--the confusion should be enough. This is the first step.
You don't know what'll happen?
I don't like surprises.
Like I said, the confusion should be enough. You'll have to improvise the particulars. That's what makes it fun.
Why can't I just use the tech to disable him?
Why do I have to do that?
You wouldn't be able to get close enough with his bodyguards present.
Then I use the anti-cyborg prototype to disable him, right?
And the tech next.
Exactly.
With the bodyguards gone, you can get close enough to Skotia to use the prototype you stole from Grathan's.
But be mindful--Skotia may be more machine than man, but he's no weakling in the Force. Killing him will still be a challenge.
It wouldn't be fun if it wasn't.
Excellent.
Do you really think I'm ready for this?
You think I can do it?
Of course. You ravaged four tombs on Korriban and tamed a Dashade--what's a crippled Dark Lord to you?
Challenge! Ha! I spit on challenges!
I doubt it.
Oh, I wish I could be there to see the contortions on Skotia's malformed face when you destroy him.
Now if you'll excuse me, I'm due to make an appearance at a party in the Nexus Room cantina. Meet me there when you're done.
Now, go, my little serpent, and strike. Your prey awaits.
I promise, I will not be long.
I'm gone.
As you say.
Excellent. Once Skotia's dead, we may pursue Tulak Hord's power in earnest.
What will you be doing while I do your dirty work?
And you?
I'll be sipping Somnaskol Red and drawing lots of attention to myself.
Skotia's chambers are on the second floor of this place. Don't forget: relic first to take care of his bodyguards, and then the tech.
Not a moment too soon, apprentice. Tell me we were successful. Tell me you have the tech we need to destroy Skotia.
I have the prototype.
It is done.
Stop saying "we." I was successful, not you.
I'm the one doing the work.
It's time to kill Skotia!
Yes!
Fantastic. Magnificent. Perfect. Then the time to do the deed is now.
Good work finding the relic, but we still need the prototype from Lord Grathan's estate.
His greatest weakness is that he's mostly machine. The rogue Sith Lord Grathan is holding a cyborg expert named Dorotsech captive.
He has developed a neutralizer for me, the kind that should destroy Skotia's cyborg elements. Find Dorotsech, get him to tell you where the neutralizer is and then silence him.
You want me to kill him.
I see.
Whatever it takes.
Yes, master.
Do you have any other instructions for me?
Anything else?
No, that's all, for now.
Grathan's estate is in the jungle--interrogate the scientist.
Skotia's days are numbered.
We'll be victorious.
Excellent. I knew you would not fail me.
I will not fail.
I just want to leave.
Can I go now?
Of course, I won't hold you any longer.
With any luck, Skotia will soon be out of our way. And then we'll be free to pursue Tulak Hord's lost power as we please.
Ha. The power of Tulak Hord in the hands of a child. What a mockery.
I've recovered the Trandoshan relic.
Then we've both had success in our endeavors. But the Trandoshan bodyguards are only part of Skotia's defense.
Does this mean you've found them? You've found the archaeological plans?
Hope there's not too much blood on them.
They got a little dirty.
Oh no, no--I've read much, much worse.
Of course.
Have I ever failed you?
Do I make mistakes?
Fantastic. I never doubted you.
Now, let me see.... ah yes. How clever--there's a chamber hidden under the colossus itself!
I'd bet my complete collection of Naga Sadow's Yavin Four writings that you'll find what we're looking for in this chamber.
Tell me how to access this chamber.
How do I get in?
Yes, master.
I'll get inside if I have to destroy the whole colossus!
I'll break my way in!
Such zeal--but destroying the colossus won't be necessary.
There should be a hidden entrance near the colossus. It looks like Skotia has an entire underground base. You're looking for a tablet.
The tablet will be key to defeating Skotia.
I'll remove the stone tablet from the chamber.
Understood.
What does this tablet do?
Tablet?
It's not what it does, dear apprentice, but what it means.
What's your fascination with dusty artifacts?
More rocks.
The glory of the Sith is built on dusty artifacts, dear apprentice--but this is not such an artifact.
The tablet is the symbol of leadership of an obscure Trandoshan cult--the lizards believe it was a gift from their deity, the Scorekeeper.
Skotia stole the tablet and uses it to exert control over his Trandoshan bodyguards. Give them their relic, and Skotia's power over his bodyguards will turn to vapor.
His own defenses will be his downfall.
And then they'll kill him.
You could try it--it might weaken him a little. Skotia's not stupid enough to retain guards who could actually overpower him.
The main thing is to keep Skotia's bodyguards off you.
We'll leave Skotia undefended.
I get it.
Exactly. You have a sharp mind, apprentice.
How is this going to help me kill Skotia?
I don't understand.
You won't be able to lay a finger on Skotia with his bodyguards around. Taking them out is essential to our plan.
The plans suggest Skotia's apprentices guard this base. I don't doubt they hold the keys to acquiring the Trandoshan tablet. Best kill them all to be sure.
Command me and I will eat them.
You must go to the colossus and contact me when you find the plans.
I've begun to piece together the puzzle for Darth Skotia's destruction--but some elements have yet to fall into place.
I need you to look into some things for me--see if we can't get these pieces to fit.
What am I looking for?
What do I do?
But what happens if they don't fit?
What if we fail?
There's always a backup plan--but trust me, I feel we are close.
Wait--I thought you had this all worked out!
This is your plan?
The perfect plan is an illusion, but this one, I feel, has a reasonable chance of success.
Out in the jungle, a group of slaves has recently revolted. They were working on a colossal statue that has since gone unfinished.
I believe Skotia is hiding something of great importance near this statue. Get the archaeological plans to the area from one of the slaves and contact me by holocommunicator.
This witch stinks of death. Give me the command and I will devour her.
Are you acquainted with a big, ugly, half-machine Dark Lord? He had a message for you.
People aren't friendly here.
Damn Skotia! What business has he, going behind my back, speaking to my apprentice! Trying to intimidate you, no doubt.
Wretched monster. More machine than man and dangerously powerful. Ever since I arrived on Dromund Kaas as an apprentice, he's made every effort to stand in my way.
He is flesh. He can be killed.
Ultimately, we cannot even begin the search for Tulak Hord's ancient power with Skotia's rattling breath on our necks.
There must be something we can do.
We have to stop him.
Yes, yes. There is something we can do--or rather, something you can do.
Sounds like Skotia's got us on this one.
So we're stuck.
No. Not quite. You see, I have a plan.
Somebody should stop him from breathing, then.
We should kill him.
Yes--and that somebody is you.
You are going to kill Skotia for me.
I can't kill him! He's too powerful!
What?
Exactly. That's the genius of my plan.
Why me?
Wouldn't I love to. It would be much simpler that way.
Finally, a challenge worthy of me.
No problem.
Good. That's precisely the attitude you'll need.
I cannot be tied to Skotia's murder. Brazen power plays make the Dark Council nervous.
But nobody will believe that a mere apprentice could defeat Skotia. It's impossible, and that's why it will work.
So what am I supposed to do?
Instructions?
The impossible's my specialty.
My pleasure.
So it seems.
Sounds like you relax while I do your dirty work.
And you can take it easy.
Dear apprentice, where I go, you go. If I go up, you come with me. Meanwhile, I must make plans for when we get there. So, listen closely.
